document: Legacy Information Systems are large, vital software systems that resist modification and evolution. Solutions for these systems include freezing, outsourcing, maintenance, discarding, wrapping, and migration. Wrapping involves encapsulating legacy components with new software layers (Forward, Backward, System, Application, and Function wrappers) across various levels of encapsulation (Process, Transaction, Program, Module, and Procedure).

questions.question: How do Brodie and Stonebraker define legacy systems?
options: Systems that are easy to update to meet new business requirements
Any information system that significantly resists modification and evolution
Small software systems that are no longer vital to an organization
Systems written in modern programming languages
questions.answer: Any information system that significantly resists modification and evolution

questions.question: According to Bennett, what characterizes legacy software systems?
options: Small systems that are easy to manage
Systems that are not vital to the organization
Large software systems we don't know how to cope with but are vital
questions.answer: Large software systems we don't know how to cope with but are vital
